Sadhguru invites you to be part of a moment in history as a unique statue of Adiyogi is consecrated at Isha Yoga Center.
February 24, 2017
Isha Yoga Center
“Adiyogi predates all religion; in celebration of the universality of his methods, this glorious face of 112 ft height.” – Sadhguru
Sadhguru invites you to be part of a moment in history as a unique statue of Adiyogi is consecrated at Isha Yoga Center. A towering 112 feet high, this iconic statue represents the 112 ways one can attain to oneâ€™s ultimate nature.
On this Mahashivratri, you will have the rare opportunity to make an offering to Adiyogi. In doing so, you become available to an outpouring of grace, and a dimension of the beyond. On this day, Sadhguru will share his intimate experience of Adiyogi with the world.
Come and bask in the grace of the ultimate.
The Nightlong Festival features
• Explosive Meditations
• Discourse by Sadhguru
• Maha Annadanam
Performers of the Night
s
Live webstream at: isha.sadhguru.org/MSR
February 20–23, 2017
Isha Yoga Center,
Velliangiri Foothills,
Coimbatore
“Participating in a consecration of this nature is a tremendously powerful process. If you had to earn what is being offered here, without guidance, it would take lifetimes of heart-breaking sadhana. Here it is radiating free. If you imbibe this, you must also radiate and reverberate.” – Sadhguru
You are invited to be part of a life-transforming process during which Sadhguru will consecrate a unique Yogeshwar Linga that will be installed with the 112-foot statue of Adiyogi on Mahashivratri.
A time to soak in a realm of spiritual possibilities. A space to immerse yourself in a cascade of grace. Come, participate in the creation of a doorway to liberation.
As a participant, you are encouraged to volunteer for the consecration preparation. This is an opportunity to let your devotion find full expression during this auspicious time and beyond.

For Enquiries and Registration
In an endeavor to preserve and promote the uniqueness, purity and diversity of the countryâ€™s performing arts, Isha Foundation annually hosts Yaksha, a three-day festival of culture, music and dance with performances by renowned artistes.
Named after celestial beings in Indian mythology, Yaksha provides a platform for great artistes to perform and connoisseurs to appreciate these ancient arts performed by masters.
We invite you to immerse yourself in the legacy of Indiaâ€™s majestic ancient culture and be drawn into the depths of a profound experience.
